intro: Paronychia boissieri, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arid regions of North America. It has small, gray-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Paronychia boissieri is well adapted to harsh, desert conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
